Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined and also joining 57479) of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, perhaps a wine-jar, the fabric is grey in section and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text - The Teaching of Amenemhat = ed. Helck 6a-f (on 57479).
Curator's comments: from House M 30.1. From same pot as 1924,1011.86 Published: Parkinson, ‘The Teaching of King Amenemhat I at el-Amarna: EA 57458 and 57479’ in A. Leahy and J. Tait (ed.), Studies on Ancient Egypt in Honour of H. S. Smith (Occasional Publications 13, 2000; London: Egypt Exploration Society), 221-6. Published: F. Adrom, Die Lehre des Amenemhet (BAe 19, 2006). Translation of Amenemhat: Parkinson, The Tale of Sinuhe and other Ancient Egyptian Poems 1940-1640 BC (Oxford World's Classics 1999), 203-11.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393398) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393398)
